tasks.task: Build cold frames under a black walnut tree.
subtasks: Remove snow from the construction area.
Allow the ground to dry to facilitate working.
Cut boards into rectangular shapes for the frames.
Ensure the boards are level using a reference surface (e.g., father's deck).
Construct the bottom sections of the cold frames.
Assemble the top sections of the cold frames using pine 2x2 footers.
Fill the frames with soil from a nearby pile.
Fit the frames on the ground to check stability and adjust as needed.
Attach a Tuftex panel or substitute plastic to the top of each frame.
Add hinges to allow opening the cold frames partially or fully.
Consider reinforcing hinges if necessary for durability.
Monitor the performance of the built cold frames.
